channel.title: Blogs on ADeveloperHasNoName
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on ADeveloperHasNoName

item.title: What are HTTP and HTTPS Protocols?
item.description: An in-depth look at what the HTTP protocol is, how it works, its methods, status codes, versions, and security features. Learn how HTTP enables communication between clients and servers over the internet.

item.title: What Are Browser HTTP Cookies?
item.description: An in-depth look at what browser HTTP cookies are, why they are used, how they work, and their attributes. Learn how cookies are used for session management, personalization, tracking, and advertising on the web.

item.title: What Is OAuth (2.0)? | Definition, Use Cases, and How it Works
item.description: A comprehensive guide to understanding OAuth (2.0), its definition, use cases, and how it works to grant secure access to user data.

item.title: Overcoming Concurrent Refresh Attempts of Access Tokens (JWT)
item.description: A deep dive into handling concurrent refresh attempts of access tokens in a single-page application using JWT, OAuth, and Redis-based locking mechanisms to enhance token management security.

item.title: Overcoming (discord) API Rate Limits With Redis Cache
item.description: How to handle (Discord) API rate limits using a Redis-based caching mechanism in a web application.
